p.s: Description of Leptospirillum gen. nov., nom. rev.
Leptospirillum (lep'to.spi.ril'lum. Gr. adj. leptos thin, fine ; Gr. n. speira a spiral ; M.L. neut. n. Leptospirillum thin spiral)
Cells are vibrioid to spirilla-shaped, the latter consisting of 3–12 cells giving a Spirillum-like morphology; cocci and pseudococci can be formed.
Motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
Acidophilic; grows in a pH range of 1∙3–4∙0.
Mesophilic or moderately thermophilic with an upper limit around 55 °C.
Chemoautotrophic growth by oxidation of ferrous iron, but not of sulphur or thiosulphate.
Pyrite and pyritic ore may or may not be utilized.
The G+C content of the DNA is 50–57 mol%.
The type species is Leptospirillum ferrooxidans.
Currently, the genus Leptospirillum includes two species, L. ferrooxidans and L. thermoferrooxidans.
